title: 109_hr377
content: The Act may be cited as the "Honoring Every Requirement of Exemplary Service Act of 2005" or the "HEROES Act of 2005". Death gratuity enhancements are included in the Act. The "HEROES Act of 2005" includes death gratuity enhancements, increasing the death gratuity to $100,000 for deaths resulting from combat-related causes or designated operations. The "HEROES Act of 2005" increases death gratuity to $100,000 for combat-related deaths or designated operations. Amendments include adjustments to death gratuity amounts and additional gratuity payments for deaths before the effective date. The "HEROES Act of 2005" increases death gratuity to $100,000 for combat-related deaths or designated operations. Amendments include adjustments to death gratuity amounts and additional gratuity payments for deaths before the effective date, specifically for members of the Armed Forces who died as a direct result of wounds, injuries, or illnesses incurred in Operation Enduring Freedom or Operation Iraqi Freedom. The "HEROES Act of 2005" increases death gratuity to $238,000 for combat-related deaths or designated operations. Beneficiaries entitled to the regular military death gratuity will also receive the additional death gratuity in cases of members who died as a direct result of wounds, injuries, or illnesses incurred in Operation Enduring Freedom or Operation Iraqi Freedom. The additional death gratuity, provided under the "HEROES Act of 2005," is payable to beneficiaries entitled to the regular military death gratuity in cases of combat-related deaths or designated operations. If there are multiple beneficiaries, the amount each receives is based on the ratio of their regular military death gratuity share to the total amount payable. The regular military death gratuity is defined as a death gratuity payable under specific sections of title 10, United States Code. SEC. 3. SERVICEMEMBERS' GROUP LIFE INSURANCE ENHANCEMENTS. Increased Maximum Amount Under Servicemembers' Group Life Insurance to $400,000 and additional amount for members serving in certain areas or operations. The maximum amount under Servicemembers' Group Life Insurance has been increased to $400,000. Additionally, members serving in designated combat operations or zones are eligible for an increased coverage amount. The Secretary designates combat operations or zones for increased insurance coverage of $150,000 for members serving in those areas. The total insurance payable for a member cannot exceed $400,000. The insurance coverage for members serving in designated combat operations or zones is increased to $150,000. The total insurance payable for a member cannot exceed $400,000. Contributions towards insurance costs are made from the appropriation for active duty pay. Members serving in designated combat operations or zones will have their insurance coverage increased to $150,000. The total insurance payable for a member cannot exceed $400,000. Contributions towards insurance costs are made from the appropriation for active duty pay. Members serving in designated combat operations or zones will have their insurance coverage increased to $150,000, with a total cap of $400,000. Regulations require notice to the spouse regarding a member's election to decline or reduce insurance coverage. Members with spouses must obtain written consent from their spouse to decline or reduce insurance coverage under this subchapter. Additionally, any modifications to beneficiaries designated by the member require written consent from the spouse. These requirements will take effect more than 90 days after the enactment of the Act.
